entry.title: Audio: Use real Audio MIDI channel layout instead of guessing one
entry.content:
Audio MIDI allow user setup channel layout configurations, and

there are some layouts with the same number of channels, i.e:



6 channel: 5.1, Hexagonal.

8 channel: 7.1, 7.1 Surround, 5.1.2, Octagonal.



Chromium previous only get the number of device channels and

guess a channel layout based on it, i.e:



6 channel: guess it as 5.1.

8 channel: guess it as 7.1 Surround.



This will not be accurate and causes incorrect multi channel

audio downmix.



To fix the issue, we can retrieve the device channel layout and

map it to a chromium layout, then downmix will work properly.



If the mapping fails because of unknown label (i.e: Octagonal

and 5.1.2) or physical channel count > 8 (i.e: 7.1.4) which means

chromium currently not able to handle such device channel layout,

then treat the layout as `CHANNEL_LAYOUT_DISCRETE`. Eventually

although this will disable the downmix, it could at least ensures

the channel mapping is correct and hope for the best.



Bug: 40809490

Bug: 41495709

Bug: 41487675

Change-Id: Ibd7265abee01bd95eec052a5a4ab8132961437f5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5291314

Reviewed-by: Thomas Guilbert

entry.title: [wptrunner] Treat all subtest mismatches as regressions
entry.content:
*Note to gardeners*: If this CL introduces a few new failures, please

prefer adding TestExpectations with filed bugs to reverting, as the

large footprint makes merge conflicts likely.



To more closely emulate the baseline checking behavior of

`run_web_tests.py`, remove `--no-fail-on-unexpected-pass`. Instead, the

test loader always adds temporary test-level PASSes that may be removed

later when reporting results to ResultDB. This allows us to:

* Remove newly discovered stale expectations.

* Prevent new unexpected subtest passes from landing. Such mismatches

will fail the build now and require rebaselining.

* Simplify the result reporting logic in `WPTResultsProcessor`.



Bug: 40943761

Change-Id: Ifdf6342f1247089fec92750b9f69fd4ee0361353

entry.title: Account for collapsed tab groups when wheel scrolling the tab strip
entry.content:
On linux, wheel scrolling the tab strip changes tabs. When at the

beginning or end of the tab strip we don't loop around. However,

when a collapsed tab group is at the beginning or end, we try to select

the prev/next tab, but we can't so this loops around to find a tab that

isn't collapsed.



We now check that there is a selectable tab in the intended direction.



In addition to adding a test for this scenario, I also added a test to

cover a basic case with regular tabs, as I couldn't find any existing

tests for this.



Bug: 40880871

Change-Id: I8ef5598cda95960fd7d69d3d967d9e62d971e10d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5282539

Commit-Queue: Kevin McNee

Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

entry.title: gpu: Support multiplanar SIs in CopySharedImage
entry.content:
Sometimes we need to convert RGBA to YUV with a copy [1]. Eventually

in CopySharedImageHelper::CopySharedImage, we will attempt to wait

on the begin semaphores from the src image in the dst image. Here,

we assume the dst is single planar when we call

dest_scoped_access->surface() and fail the single planar CHECK in

SkiaImageRepresentation::surface because the YUV dest is

multiplanar.



This CL fixes the issue by using GrDirectContext::wait instead of

directly waiting on the SkSurface.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/renderers/video_frame_rgba_to_yuva_converter.cc;l=196;drc=fb8ce25718b692359363731ec54e1c60e11e54e9



Bug: b:324945802

entry.title: Revert "[Omnibox] Don't calculate visible hint if TLD is different."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0ec9052745d657127f3b27808fa1cfb350528a15.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5700561204674560



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8756175429374846529

Affected test(s):

[ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.customtabs.TrustedCdnPublisherUrlTest#testNavigateAway](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fchrome%2Fandroid:chrome_public_test_apk%2Forg.chromium.chrome.browser.customtabs.TrustedCdnPublisherUrlTest%23testNavigateAway?q=VHash%3Ab4b4cb73fffd626a)

If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5700561204674560&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5251965&type=BUG

entry.content:

virtual.

PDF viewer wouldn't work with these implementations, anyway. Instead,

make PdfStreamDelegate an interface, so that derived classes must be

entry.title: hevc: Provide a raster scan order view of ScalingList[*][matrixId][*]
entry.content:
In media::H265ScalingListData, the arrays scaling_list_4x4[matrixId][*],

scaling_list_8x8[matrixId][*], scaling_list_16x16[matrixId][*], and

scaling_list_32x32[matrixId][*] correspond to the spec arrays

ScalingList[0][matrixId][*], ScalingList[1][matrixId][*],

ScalingList[2][matrixId][*], and ScalingList[3][matrixId][*]

respectively. Section 7.4.5 (equations 7-44, 7-45, 7-46, and 7-48) imply

that the elements of these arrays are in up-right diagonal order (see

also 7.4.3.2.1 and 6.5.3). As an example, assume that the 4x4 scaling

data for matrixId is the following matrix indexed by (x, y):



x=0 x=1 x=2 x=3

________________

y=0 | a b c d

y=1 | e f g h

y=2 | i j k l

y=3 | m n o p



Then,



scaling_list_4x4[matrixId] =

{a, e, b, i, f, c, m, j, g, d, n, k, h, o, l, p}



Some hw acceleration APIs (such as the VA-API [1]) expect the scaling

data in raster scan order instead of up-right diagonal scan order.

Therefore, for the same matrix, they would want to see:



scaling_list_4x4_raster[matrixId] =

{a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i, j, k, l, m, n, o, p}



Note: "raster scan" is defined in 3.127.



Therefore we need a way to convert from up-right diagonal scan order to

raster scan order. This CL does that by adding the following methods:



- H265ScalingListData::GetScalingList4x4EntryInRasterOrder()

- H265ScalingListData::GetScalingList8x8EntryInRasterOrder()

- H265ScalingListData::GetScalingList16x16EntryInRasterOrder()

- H265ScalingListData::GetScalingList32x32EntryInRasterOrder()



It then uses those methods in our VA-API code to fill out the

VAIQMatrixBufferHEVC members correctly. Prior to this CL, we were

passing the data to the VA-API driver in up-right diagonal scan order

which resulted in band artifacts in the bitstream (see b:321622872).



The reason we don't just fill out scaling_list_4x4[matrixId] in the

raster scan order is that it seems not all APIs have the same

requirement as the VA-API. In particular, based on my cursory look at

the ffmpeg code for DXVA2, it seems that API expects up-right diagonal

scan ordered data (side note: my understanding is that ffmpeg converts

to raster scan order at a high level [2] and then undoes that conversion

for DXVA2 [3, 4] -- this "undoing" does not seem to be done for VA-API

[5]).



I validated this CL by running our VA-API decode_test [6] on a brya

device using:



LIBVA_TRACE=decode_test_trace \

./decode_test --video=b_321622872.hevc --codec=H265 --md5



(where b_321622872.hevc comes from b:321622872 (comment 10)).



I then compared the generated libva trace with a libva trace obtained

using ffmpeg to ensure the first VAIQMatrixBufferHEVC submitted to the

driver is identical in the two scenarios.



I also compared the output MD5 sums against b_321622872.hevc.json (from

the same bug).



Special credits to the ffmpeg code since that's where I got inspiration

for the fix.



[1] https://github.com/intel/libva/blob/df1272c8a6dbce61be4841906e65aae722098a86/va/va_dec_hevc.h#L559

[2] https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/blob/395469c1b091bee355517fb3a90e6f0b6b10558a/libavcodec/hevc_ps.c#L773-L778

[3] https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/blob/395469c1b091bee355517fb3a90e6f0b6b10558a/libavcodec/dxva2_hevc.c#L213-L225

[4] https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/commit/b11994593ae4c3856db735800f24d38293838759

[5] https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/blob/395469c1b091bee355517fb3a90e6f0b6b10558a/libavcodec/vaapi_hevc.c#L316-L323

[6] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/gpu/vaapi/BUILD.gn;l=326-379;drc=b19600ed9d3575b07a3fdb3a32e21296901461c7



Bug: b:239936640,b:321622872

Test: LIBVA_TRACE=decode_test_trace ./decode_test --video=b_321622872.hevc --codec=H265 --md5 (on brya).

Test: play back the full video from the b:321622872 description in Chrome and ensure hw acceleration is used and no band artifacts are observed (on brya).

Test: tast run --var=expectations.disable=true ${brya} video.PlatformDecoding.vaapi_hevc* video.ChromeStackDecoderVerification.*hevc*

Test: tast run --var=expectations.disable=true ${skyrim} video.PlatformDecoding.vaapi_hevc* video.ChromeStackDecoderVerification.*hevc*

Change-Id: Ia3f2a57585e315cbe8f7b60fb858a588d10f330e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5280579

Reviewed-by: Dan Sanders

entry.title: NTP: Recover hover effect after a drag-and-drop is canceled
entry.content:
In the new tab page, the hover effect is disabled while a shortcut item

is being dragged (specifically while `reordering_` is true). This flag

is not disabled immediately after the user drops the shortcut in order

to prevent flickering, and disabled on a next pointermove event instead.



Currently the pointermove handler is registered only when the user drops

a shortcut successfully and not registered when the drag-and-drop is

canceled. This causes a bug when the user drags a shortcut to out of the

page.



This CL fixes the issue by registering the pointermove event handler on

dragend event.



Bug: b:324841546

Change-Id: I61bf064f17622331f03785a06987bcbe4abe67bd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5289874

Reviewed-by: Roman Arora

entry.title: Do not change compositor visibility on minimize with native occlusion
entry.content:
Currently, the ui compositor will be set to not visible if it is

minimized. But, if we have native occlusion controlling visibility, then

the window state should be irrelevant to the visibility. This CL stops

visibility being changed based on window state.

entry.title: Fenced frames: Disable popup navigations after network revocation
entry.content:
Navigations into and out of fenced frames need to be treated specially

for network revocation, because they don't have the revoked partition

nonce attached.



Previous CLs disabled embedder-initiated fenced frame root navigations

and _unfencedTop navigations; this CL disables popup navigations.

entry.title: Compute input region using correct pixel size.
entry.content:
This also set input region instead of opaque region for rounded corners.



Opaque region is used only to tell if the quad is opaque in exo [1][2].

Since lacros is already using rounded corner API, there is no need

to use opaque_region protocol. Instead just update the input region.



This opaque region can make the surface not occluding other window because the opaque region can be smaller than actual content.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/exo/surface.cc;drc=35406c8d4b7301ede262aeedfc6a63e5e3cf555d;l=1332

[2]https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/exo/surface.cc;drc=35406c8d4b7301ede262aeedfc6a63e5e3cf555d;l=1608

entry.content:

produce excessive logs because that this IP address is not guaranteed to

entry.title: Use scroll margin for iframes' lazy loader.
entry.content:
When creating an intersection observer for an iframe lazy loader we use

the margin values we get from GetLazyLoadingFrameMarginPx as the value

for the scroll margin and not for the root margin, to allow lazy

loading for iframes.



(Also including fix to the test expectations and a minor fix for one of

the tests)

entry.content:
This CL makes the accessible text offsets we compute for the

Textfield relative to the origin. This means that the computed

text offsets are not display offset independent.



In the next CL, we'll reapply the offset later in the pipeline

so the final text bounds computed for a range have the right

location on screen.

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[ Companion ] Migrate Companion pref into PinnedActionsToolbarModel Fix""
entry.content:
This reverts commit e10bd68dfb6b4aafebc631d37d704bf18ed85981.



Reason for revert: This is probably causing the following tests

to fail on ChromeOS:

CompanionUtilsTest.PinnedStateCommandlineOverridePinned

CompanionUtilsTest.PinnedStateCommandlineOverrideUnpinned



With the following error:

pref_service.cc(564): Check failed: false. Trying to write an unregistered pref: side_panel.companion_pinned_to_toolbar



Original change's description:

> Reland "[ Companion ] Migrate Companion pref into PinnedActionsToolbarModel Fix"

>

> See Patchset 1 vs 2 for what has changed from original cl. To fix

> crashing checks were added to companion related code in

> PinnedToolbarActionsContainer and SidePanelToolbarContainer to make sure

> the companion feature is enabled before attempting to trigger the

> companion migration. This was likely causing the crashing since it

> appeared the majority of crash instances had side panel pinning with

> responsive toolbar enabled but not companion. Also update any added

> checks for the kSidePanelPinning flag to instead use

> IsSidePanelPinningEnabled method which also checks the chrome refresh.

>

> This is a reland of commit 58df1606dcc1ab89958c0d38ce7cb542aa9a4a65

>

> Original change's description:

> > [ Companion ] Migrate Companion pref into PinnedActionsToolbarModel Fix

> >

> > Fixes a bug where the migration of the

> > `kSidePanelCompanionEntryPinnedToToolbar` profile pref only happened on

> > startup / instantiation of the PinnedToolbarActionsModel even though

> > the pref could be changed at any point during a browser's session.

> >

> > To fix this, we call the migration code any time

> > CompanionUtils::UpdateCompanionDefaultPinnedToolbarState is called.

> > This will attempt to migrate the pref into the

> > PinnedToolbarActionsModel, if it hasn't already. All current callers

> > at the time this was written are covered by this change.

> >

> > Change-Id: I2e27bf475d81a082f9f4feeca846b9b8fd4bc764

> > Bug: b:324595742

entry.title: Revert "[AsyncSB] Add PostCommitInterstitial browser tests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1f89e4520df8ef8cb5e41b2db9373767fd906fb6.



Reason for revert: Flakily failing on linux-bfcache-rel (BFCache-disabled bot). Sample failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel/56283/overview



Original change's description:

> [AsyncSB] Add PostCommitInterstitial browser tests

>

> Previously, several subresource browser tests were disabled because of

> kSafeBrowsingSkipSubresources. Some of these tests are in essence

> testing the functionality of post commit interstitial and should not

> be limited to warnings triggered by subresources.

>

> This CL ports the tests that are relevant to post commit interstitial

> under SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest. It reveals an

> issue that the security indicator is persisted if the Safe Browsing

> check is completed between ProcessResponse and FinishNavigation

> (see the TODO in SecurityStateGoBackOnPostCommitInterstitial). It

> will be fixed in a follow up CL.

>

> The old tests are removed entirely since we plan to clean up the

> kSafeBrowsingSkipSubresources flag soon.

>

> This CL also removes the "MAYBE" before

> IframeOptInAndReportThreatDetails. We will monitor if this test is still

> flaky on Mac.

entry.title: Write unsafe review for BufferIterator and use safer span methods
entry.content:
Replaces all memcpy() calls with span::copy_from(). Adds

UNSAFE_BUFFERS() around any unsafe pointer arithmetic, which is an

intrinsic requirement of this type, so we can't convert them all to

spans. Adds SAFETY comments on any UNSAFE_BUFFERS(). Mark the

constructor from pointer/size as UNSAFE_BUFFER_USAGE and deprecated.



We move the unittests for BufferIterator over to the world of

unsafe-buffer-usage warnings. To do so, we must silence warnings

through the raw_ptr/raw_ref headers (and, sadly, their transitive

includes!!!) so we add UNSAFE_BUFERS_INCLUDE_BEGIN/END macros to

assist with that for now, with TODOs. Also the same for the

contiguous iterator include.



Bug: 40284755

Change-Id: Iad38db2ea8c695cdf1c1aab06140315654a00f81

entry.title: documentScan: Reduce confirmation prompts for discovery
entry.content:
The first time an extension calls documentScan.getScannerList, the user

sees a dialog to approve or deny the request. Once they have approved,

allow subsequent user-initiated discovery requests for the remainder of

the session. Since the user has already approved this extension, they

won't be surprised that clicking a button can trigger re-discovery.

Unsolicited discovery requests will still display the confirmation

prompt.



Bug: b/312740272

Test: Repeated discovery with test extension

entry.title: [Mac File Menu] Reland of Display and enable correct Close menu items
entry.content:
Chrome Mac has "Close Tab" and "Close Window" menu items in the File

menu for browser windows, and just "Close Window" for non-browser

windows. This cl fixes a problem where the "Close Tab" menu item

would sometimes lose its Cmd-W keyboard shortcut. Because of a quirk

in the AppKit, the solution involves swapping menu items rather than

changing their assigned keyboard shortcuts.



Changes since the previous incarnation:



1. Avoids triggering PA test failures

2. Works around a problem where mainWindow is nil on Ventura+ when

running from the test harness.

3. Fixes another persistent test failure

4. Code cleanup to make it easier to reason about what it's doing and why



Test: out/Debug/unit_tests \

--gtest_filter=AppControllerKeyEquivalentTest*

out/Debug/browser_tests \

--gtest_filter=AppControllerProfilePickerBrowserTest.MenuCommands



Bug: 1465158



Include-Ci-Only-Tests: true

entry.title: Remove several overrides of Views::GetClassName
entry.content:
Metadata macros already create a GetClassName function. For classes

that already implement metadata GetClassName is not needed especially

since most of the time the returned classname is the same as the macro

version. Remove these overrides. For classes that do not have

metadata implemented, implement metadata and then remove overrides.



No class name changes for the files in this CL

entry.title: [UniversalInstall]: Implement 'open-instead?'
entry.content:
When a webapp is already installed, we should -- instead of

showing Install -- show a message explaining that the app

has been previously installed, but can be opened instead.



Also, I discovered while implementing this that the icon

fetching code doesn't work for already installed apps

(ones that we suggest opening instead), because it fetches

the icon found from the installability check pipeline.



So, I ripped the icon fetching code out

and wrote a different one that works for both installed

and not installed apps. The new one is asynchronous, so

two spinners were added to the dialog.



Bug: 1520511

entry.title: fix: SkiaOutputDeviceOffscreen use GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE_ARB when
entry.content:
SkiaOutputSurface use it





Currently SkiaOutputSurface will create a characteristic that backend_format

will be kRectangle if the build is for macOS.

But when the output_device is SkiaOutputDeviceOffscreen, the surface check

will fail at GrSurfaceProxy::validateSurface saying:

surface->asTexture()->textureType() != this->textureType()



This fix make SkiaOutputDeviceOffscreen use same backend_format when

creating Backbuffers.

entry.title: [Protected Audiences] Remove some instances of "Url" from WPT tests.
entry.content:
Most APIs have been switched from "Url" to "URL", so tests should

reflect that. Using the right string also reduces deprecation warnings

when running tests.



This CL also migrates "dailyUpdateUrl" to "updateURL" in some tests.



This CL leaves alone a couple cases where "Url" values are needed to

run object equality comparisons, and most of the usage in

trusted-scoring-signals.py, which still receives query params

"renderUrls" and "adComponentRenderUrls", and no additional "URL"

argument, though this cl does update it to return a JSON response with

a "renderURLs" section instead of "renderUrls" (the component ad

section had already been updated).

entry.title: Add WPT test validating that drawImage writes to the layer
entry.content:
Added a WPT to check that using `drawImage` inside a layer writes the

image to the layer and not it's parent directly. The test uses

`drawImage` with another canvas as source, inside a layer that applies a

filter and uses the global composite operation `xor`. In its reference,

the same drawing commands are used in the main canvas inside the layer,

to verify that the filter effect is applied on the image, and that the

compositing of the `drawImage` operation is done with the layer's content

and not the parent's.

entry.title: Fix min-content related crash in `LineBreaker::SplitTrailingBidiPreservedSpace`
entry.content:
In crrev.com/c/5199988, the `SplitTrailingBidiPreservedSpace` method

was added to the `LineBreaker` class, which is called right at the end

of line breaking. This method fixes a bidi bug where trailing spaces

were not being reset to the paragraph's bidi direction, and it does so

by splitting some item results (and their shape results) into two

after their construction.



This method assumes that non-empty item results always have a non-null

shape result. This is usually the case, but when computing the minimum

and maximum sizes of an inline node (e.g. for `{min,max}-content`), a

fast path is used (`LineBreak::HandleTextForFastMinContent`) which

creates inline item results with a null shape result. This caused a

crash when trying to create a `ShapeResultView` without a source shape

result.



This patch fixes this by adding an early return from

`LineBreaker::SplitTrailingBidiPreservedSpace` if the line breaker

mode is `kMinContent`. This is incorrect, but it can only affect the

hanging behavior of trailing other space separators, which is already

incorrect with `{min,max}-content` even in non-bidi text. We are

already working on fixing this behavior, and we don't expect any

breakage resulting from this early return.



Bug: 324684931

Change-Id: I6a5a7aae06a0aafdb34b5836030921041d50dfb3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5291239

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

entry.title: WebUI: Handle dependencies between Lit styles in css_to_wrapper().
entry.content:
Changing the generated getCss() function to

1) Return a CSSResultGroup instead.

2) Always return the same instance, no matter how many times it is

called. This is necessary for Lit to correctly deduplicate styles

when processing direct and transitive dependencies, and is also

better for performance (less CSSResult instances created).



This change makes css_to_wrapper() handling of dependencies

between Lit styles files equivalent to Polymer and exposes the same

comment metadata '#include=...' syntax for consistency.

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Add storage type accessor to frame pool
entry.content:
For each frame pool this adds a method for getting the frame pool

storage type - GetFrameStorageType(). These are hard-coded to match the

storage type for frames returned by GetFrame(). Runtime checks have been

added to ensure their accuracy.



The storage type is needed for VideoDecoderPipeline to create an

ImageProcessor. Having an accessor lets us change the storage type for

any frame pool independently.



Note: for PlatformVideoFrameTool, this make the member variable |lock_|

mutable. Doing this lets a scoped lock be taken from it in const

methods. This lets GetFrameStorageType() be defined as const.
